clauses.text: All commercial contracts entered into under this Act shall be governed by the principles of good faith and fair dealing. Parties shall disclose material information that could reasonably be expected to influence the contract’s performance. Failure to disclose such information shall render the contract voidable at the option of the non-disclosing party. Any disputes arising hereunder shall be resolved in accordance with the arbitration procedures set forth in this Act.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Every taxpayer shall file annual returns within six months after the end of the fiscal year. Penalties for late filing shall be imposed as provided in the Tax Penalties Act. The tax authority shall have the power to assess additional interest on overdue amounts. Appeals against assessments must be filed within 30 days of notice.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The collection and processing of personal data by automated decision-making systems shall comply with applicable privacy laws and regulations. Data subjects shall have the right to request meaningful explanations for decisions generated by algorithmic systems. Organizations employing machine learning models must implement safeguards against bias and discriminatory outcomes. Transparency reports shall be published annually as provided in Clause 1.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Employers shall provide each full-time employee with a written statement of terms and conditions of employment on the first day of work. Amendments to the statement must be communicated within 14 days of change. Employees shall acknowledge receipt in writing. The labor inspectorate may impose fines for non-compliance.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: All maritime vessels must be registered with the national transportation authority before departure. Registration shall include vessel specifications and ownership details. Failure to register shall subject the owner to administrative penalties as provided in Clause 2. The authority shall maintain a public registry accessible online.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Any use of neural networks or cognitive systems in critical infrastructure operations must be certified by the national standards body. Certification processes shall assess system resilience against cyber-attacks and operational failures. Providers of intelligent automation solutions must maintain audit logs for all automated decisions. Audit logs shall be retained for a minimum of five years under penalty of revocation of certification.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Autonomous technologies deployed in public spaces shall comply with safety standards and obtain prior approval from the municipal oversight committee. Operators shall carry liability insurance adequate to cover damages resulting from collisions or malfunctions. No system shall be deployed without a human override mechanism as required in Clause 3. Annual safety audits shall be conducted by an independent third party.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: All purchases by government agencies exceeding a value threshold shall be subject to competitive bidding processes. Invitations to bid shall be publicly advertised for a minimum of 30 days. Bidders must disclose any conflict of interest situations. The procurement authority shall maintain records of all bids and contracts for at least ten years.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Organizations deploying smart algorithms for credit scoring must ensure that algorithmic models are explainable and subject to independent review. Any adverse credit decisions based on such systems must be accompanied by an explanation of the factors considered. Affected individuals shall have the right to contest and seek human intervention. The financial regulator shall issue guidelines for compliance no later than six months after enactment.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Landowners shall not alter the natural flow of watercourses in a manner that causes flooding or erosion on adjacent properties. Permits for watercourse alteration must be obtained from the environmental agency. Violations shall incur penalties as provided in Clause 4. Restoration orders may be issued to reinstate original water flow characteristics.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Businesses engaging in cross-border trade shall comply with customs declarations and tariffs as prescribed by international trade agreements. Declarations must include accurate descriptions and valuations of goods. Non-compliance may result in seizure of goods and monetary fines. Appeals against seizure orders shall be filed within 60 days of notice.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The national tax authority shall have the power to audit any corporate taxpayer’s financial records at any time. Audits shall be conducted in accordance with standard auditing practices and guidelines. Taxpayers shall provide full cooperation, including access to documents and electronic records. Appeals against audit findings must be lodged within 90 days of notification, as provided in Clause 7 and Clause 2.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Any use of cognitive systems for medical diagnosis must comply with healthcare data protection regulations. Medical institutions shall implement data encryption both in transit and at rest. Systems employing machine learning in diagnostic processes must undergo annual validation studies. Patients shall be informed of the involvement of intelligent systems in their care decisions.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: It is prohibited to deploy autonomous systems capable of lethal force without express authorization from the relevant defense authority. Any experimental trials of autonomous weapons must be conducted under strict supervision. The defense authority shall issue guidelines for ethical use as provided in Clause 10. Violations shall constitute a crime punishable by imprisonment.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Manufacturers of robots intended for domestic use shall include safety protocols to prevent unintended operation. Users must receive training materials outlining proper operation and emergency shutdown procedures. Technical specifications shall be certified by a recognized standards organization as provided in Clause 14. Sellers shall provide a warranty covering software updates for intelligent systems for a minimum period of two years.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Employers shall maintain a safe workplace environment in accordance with occupational health and safety standards. Regular employee training on hazard identification and emergency procedures must be conducted at least once per year. Workplaces must be equipped with appropriate safety equipment and first-aid facilities. Non-compliance shall lead to inspections and potential closure orders.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Water quality standards for public drinking systems shall be established by the environmental protection agency. Water suppliers must conduct daily testing for contaminants and maintain records for at least three years. Failure to meet standards shall require public notice and remediation measures. The agency may impose administrative sanctions for repeat violations.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The cybersecurity framework for protecting critical data centers shall incorporate intelligent threat detection mechanisms. Automated anomaly detection and response systems must be integrated with human oversight. Service providers shall report cybersecurity incidents within 72 hours to the national cyber authority. Incident reports shall follow the format specified in Clause 12.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: The national minimum wage shall be adjusted annually based on the consumer price index. Adjustments shall take effect on the first day of the fiscal year. Employers may group performance bonuses with wages provided that the base wage requirement is met. The labor ministry shall publish adjustment notices at least 60 days in advance.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: All construction projects exceeding a specified budget shall require an environmental impact assessment. Assessments must consider effects on biodiversity, water resources, and local communities. The environmental agency shall review and approve assessments prior to commencement of construction. Revisions to approved assessments may be required as provided in Clause 11.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Machine learning models used for predictive maintenance in manufacturing must be validated against historical performance data. Predictive algorithms shall be subject to periodic recalibration to prevent drift. Manufacturers shall retain logs of automated maintenance recommendations for audit purposes. Records shall be stored for a minimum of three years under secure conditions.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Retailers must display total prices, including all applicable taxes and fees, in any advertisement or public offering. Price indications that omit mandatory charges shall be considered misleading. Consumer protection authorities may impose fines for non-compliance as provided in Clause 20. Retailers shall correct any misleading presentation within seven days of notification.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The development and testing of neural networks for autonomous vehicles shall adhere to safety and privacy standards. Testing on public roads requires a permit from the transportation safety board. Permits shall specify routes, times, and safety escort requirements. All test data must be anonymized and retained under conditions specified in Clause 15.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: A corporate merger shall receive antitrust approval if it does not substantially lessen competition within relevant markets. The competition authority shall assess market concentration and potential barriers to entry. Parties must submit detailed market analyses and financial disclosures. Approval may be granted with conditions to address competitive concerns.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Non-profit organizations shall file annual financial statements with the registrations registry. Statements must include income sources, expenditures, and any grants received. Failure to file may result in deregistration as provided in Clause 22. The registry shall publish a public summary of statements on its website.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Public entities employing intelligent automation for citizen services must implement accessible interfaces for users with disabilities. Automated systems shall provide alternative human-assisted support upon request. Systems must comply with universal design principles in alignment with national accessibility standards. Compliance reports shall be submitted annually to the ministry of innovation.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: The algorithmic transparency requirement for social media platforms shall mandate disclosure of ranking criteria. Platforms must publish summaries of how content is prioritized and moderated. Users shall have the option to disable personalized feeds. Transparency reports shall follow the template specified in Clause 17.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Owners of hazardous substances must register storage facilities with the chemical safety board. Facilities shall be inspected at least biannually by accredited inspectors. Storage requirements shall include secondary containment and spill response plans. Violations may result in suspension of storage permits.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Consumers may cancel distance contracts within a cooling-off period of 14 days without penalty. Service providers shall inform consumers of this right prior to contract conclusion. Notification of cancellation may be delivered by electronic means. Providers shall refund all payments within 30 days of cancellation notice.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The national intellectual property office shall grant patents for inventions that satisfy novelty, inventive step, and industrial applicability. Patent applications must include full disclosure of technical details. Patent holders shall pay renewal fees as provided in Clause 25. The office shall publish granted patents in an official journal.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Robotic automation in assembly line production shall be monitored to prevent unauthorized access and tampering. Security protocols must be updated in accordance with emerging cybersecurity threats. Manufacturers shall perform regular vulnerability assessments and penetration tests. Assessment results must be archived for five years.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Land development projects must set aside a percentage of land for public green spaces, not less than ten percent of the total area. Development plans shall be submitted to the urban planning department for approval. Plans must include provisions for tree planting and sustainable landscaping. Deviations from approved plans require a variance permit.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Smart grid technologies that utilize intelligent systems for load balancing shall incorporate fail-safe mechanisms. Utilities operating these technologies must conduct stress testing under simulated high-demand conditions. Test results shall be reported annually to the energy regulator as provided in Clause 15. Data collected during testing must be anonymized.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: The fisheries management authority shall set catch quotas based on scientific stock assessments. Quotas shall be reviewed and updated annually. Fishermen must report catch levels monthly to the authority. Exceeding quotas shall result in license suspension and fines.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Health insurers using automated decision-making for policy eligibility must ensure that intelligent systems do not discriminate based on protected characteristics. Appeals processes for program denials must include the option for human review. Insurers shall document the criteria used in algorithms and produce audit logs for compliance checks. Audit procedures shall reference the requirements established in Clause 30 and Clause 5.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: The ministry of culture shall allocate grants to eligible arts organizations through a competitive application process. Grant criteria shall include artistic merit, community engagement, and financial sustainability. Applications must be evaluated by a panel of experts. Grant recipients shall submit progress reports semiannually.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Landlords shall provide tenants with a minimum of sixty days' notice before raising rent. Rent increase notices must specify the new amount and the effective date. Tenants may contest increases before the housing tribunal within thirty days. Tribunal decisions shall be final and binding.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Education providers using adaptive learning platforms powered by artificial intelligence must protect student data in accordance with educational privacy laws. Platforms shall allow students to opt out of data collection for non-essential purposes. Providers must publish data handling policies and security measures. Non-compliance may result in revocation of platform approval.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: All healthcare providers must obtain informed consent from patients before performing any invasive procedure. Consent must be documented in writing and include information on risks, benefits, and alternatives. Emergency exceptions shall be permitted only when the patient is incapacitated and delay would harm health. Institutional review boards shall audit consent procedures annually.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The government shall publish an annual report on legislative compliance metrics across all agencies. The report shall include key performance indicators, audit findings, and corrective actions taken. Agencies must submit data to the oversight commission by March 31 of each year. Failure to submit timely data shall be addressed as provided in Clause 39.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: All financial institutions must maintain a reserve ratio of no less than 10% of total deposits at all times. The central bank shall review and adjust reserve requirements annually based on macroeconomic indicators. Institutions falling below the threshold shall submit a comprehensive capitalization plan within thirty days. Failure to comply may result in regulatory sanctions, including fines and operational restrictions.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Credit unions and cooperative banks shall follow the same reserve requirements as commercial banks. Such entities must report reserve levels to the central bank on a monthly basis. The central bank may conduct on-site inspections to verify compliance. Any discrepancies discovered during inspections shall be corrected within ten business days.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The national auditing authority shall prepare an annual report on the health of all banking institutions covered by Clauses 41 and 42. The report shall evaluate asset quality, liquidity, and governance practices. Findings must be submitted to the finance minister and made publicly available. Recommendations for policy reforms may be included where systemic risks are identified.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Regulatory sanctions imposed under this Part shall follow the procedures outlined in Clause 43. Sanctions may include monetary fines, license suspensions, or mandated restructuring plans. Affected institutions shall have the right to appeal within thirty days of receiving notice. Appeals shall be adjudicated by the financial tribunal established by this Act.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The planning board must incorporate the standards provided in Clause 6 when evaluating proposals for critical infrastructure projects. All project submissions shall include documentation demonstrating compliance with those standards. Applicants must also provide a risk assessment addressing potential cybersecurity vulnerabilities. Final approval shall not be granted until the board verifies all requirements are met.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Small business enterprises may apply for low-interest loans under the small business support program. Loan applications must include a viable business plan and financial projections for the next two fiscal years. The finance ministry shall publish eligibility criteria and application deadlines annually. Disbursement of funds shall occur within sixty days of approval.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Local authorities shall establish fair bidding procedures for public works contracts as set out in Clause 44. Bidding processes must be transparent and allow for pre-qualification of contractors. Authorities shall publish tender notices in at least two widely circulated publications. Award decisions and contract terms must be recorded in a public registry.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Environmental assessments are required for any industrial project that may significantly impact air or water quality. Assessments must include baseline studies, impact predictions, and proposed mitigation measures. The environmental agency shall review and approve assessments before project commencement. Conditional approvals may include stipulations for ongoing monitoring.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Project proponents must submit annual monitoring reports in accordance with the conditions set forth in Clause 48. Reports shall detail emissions data, water quality metrics, and any incidents of non-compliance. Failure to submit timely reports may result in suspension of project permits. The agency may impose additional remedial measures if adverse impacts are detected.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Urban zoning regulations shall designate residential, commercial, and industrial zones based on population density and infrastructure capacity. Amendments to zoning maps require a public hearing and approval by the municipal council. Developers shall consult adjacent property owners and consider potential nuisances. Final zoning decisions shall be published on the government’s planning portal.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Variances from zoning regulations may be granted by the planning commission as described in Clause 50. Applicants must demonstrate that the proposed variance will not adversely affect public health, safety, or welfare. The commission shall publish its decision and provide reasons for granting or denying the variance. Aggrieved parties may seek judicial review within sixty days of the decision.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Landlord associations shall consider the risk frameworks outlined in Clause 13 when drafting standard lease agreements. Lease templates must include provisions for data security and confidentiality obligations. Landlords are required to notify tenants of any changes to data handling practices. Failure to comply may result in penalties as prescribed by consumer protection authorities.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: The national competition authority shall monitor market concentration in the telecommunications sector. It shall collect data on market shares, subscription rates, and pricing trends. Reports shall be published biennially to inform policy interventions. The authority may recommend remedies to prevent anti-competitive practices.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Operators in the telecommunications sector must provide interconnection agreements to new market entrants as specified in Clause 53. Agreements shall include technical specifications, quality-of-service standards, and pricing terms. Disputes over interconnection may be referred to the telecommunications tribunal. Tribunal decisions are final and enforceable.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Public utility providers shall maintain service reliability standards, including maximum outage durations. The utility regulator shall issue guidelines defining acceptable performance metrics. Providers must submit quarterly performance reports. Penalties for failure to meet standards are outlined in Clause 27.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Emergency response plans for utility failures shall be developed in accordance with Clause 55. Plans must designate communication protocols, backup power sources, and staffing requirements. Providers shall conduct annual drills and document outcomes. Drill reports must be submitted to the regulator within thirty days of completion.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The labor ministry shall establish apprenticeship programs in trades experiencing skill shortages. Programs must include a minimum number of on-the-job training hours and classroom instruction. Participating employers shall receive incentive grants as detailed in Clause 46. Apprenticeship standards shall be reviewed every five years.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Termination of apprenticeship agreements shall be governed by the rules set forth in Clause 4. Employers must provide written notice and justification for termination. Apprentices may appeal termination decisions to the labor tribunal. Tribunal rulings are binding unless set aside on grounds of procedural error.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The national transportation board shall regulate ride-sharing services and issue operating licenses. Licenses shall be granted to applicants meeting vehicle safety, insurance, and driver background criteria. Services must maintain passenger safety standards and fare transparency. The board may revoke licenses for repeated violations.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Applicants for ride-sharing licenses must submit criminal background checks and vehicle inspection certificates as required in Clause 59. The board shall complete application reviews within forty-five days. Conditional licenses may be issued pending final inspection. Applicants may appeal adverse decisions to the transportation tribunal.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Financial institutions offering online trading platforms shall integrate reporting protocols specified in Clause 18 into their user notification systems. All automated alerts and responses must adhere to the incident reporting requirements for cyber threats. Institutions shall maintain logs of platform activities and coordinate with regulators on security incidents. Failure to comply may trigger remedial action by supervisory authorities.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Fishery operators must comply with catch documentation requirements as prescribed by international maritime agreements. Catch logs shall include species, weight, and location data recorded daily. Operators shall submit logs to the fisheries authority monthly. Non-compliance may result in vessel detention and license suspension.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Aquaculture facilities must follow biosecurity protocols detailed in Clause 62 to prevent disease outbreaks. Facilities shall implement quarantine measures for new stock and maintain separation buffers. Inspection reports must be filed semiannually. The fisheries authority may conduct unannounced inspections at any time.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The national archives shall preserve government records in digital and physical formats. Digital preservation standards must include metadata, format migration strategies, and access controls. Archives shall be organized according to classification schemes and retention schedules. Records disposal shall follow procedures outlined in Clause 75.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Freedom of information requests may be submitted in writing or electronically to the national archives. Requests shall specify the records sought and the purpose of disclosure. Archives shall respond within twenty business days. Fee waivers may be granted for requests in the public interest.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Public broadcasters shall ensure that news programming meets standards of accuracy, impartiality, and diversity. The broadcasting authority shall issue guidelines and review content regularly. Broadcasters must file compliance reports quarterly. Sanctions for violations are detailed in Clause 24.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Advertising content shall comply with consumer protection standards and avoid deceptive practices. Advertisers must retain substantiation for claims and provide evidence upon request. Regulatory authorities may impose corrective advertising orders as provided in Clause 29 and Clause 66. Repeat offenders may face fines and broadcast suspensions.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Road safety standards for commercial vehicles shall include weight limits, vehicle maintenance schedules, and driver hours. The transport ministry shall issue specific guidelines and enforce compliance through random inspections. Fines for violations are outlined in Clause 47. Safety certificates must be renewed annually.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Owners of cultural heritage sites must seek approval from the heritage commission before any restoration work. Applications shall include architectural plans, materials specifications, and conservation methods. The commission may impose conditions to preserve historical integrity. Approved restoration projects must be completed within three years of issuance.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Insurance providers offering cyber-risk policies shall include the reporting requirements specified in Clause 23 in their policy terms. Policyholders must notify insurers of any security assessments or incident responses related to autonomous vehicle systems. Failure to notify promptly may void coverage. Insurers shall conduct periodic audits of policyholder compliance.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Universities receiving public funding shall submit annual reports on research activities, including publications and patents. Reports must outline ethical review processes and conflict-of-interest disclosures. Research involving human subjects shall provide copies of consent forms and IRB approvals. Failure to submit reports may result in funding suspension.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Graduate scholarship awards shall be granted based on academic merit, financial need, and research potential. Selection committees must include at least one external expert. Award decisions shall be communicated within eight weeks of the application deadline. Scholarship terms and renewal criteria are described in Clause 71.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Importers of pharmaceuticals must obtain certificates of analysis from accredited laboratories. Certificates shall verify product identity, potency, and purity. The national drug authority shall audit import records annually. Non-compliant shipments shall be quarantined and subject to recall.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Pharmaceutical import certificates shall be submitted electronically as specified in Clause 73. The authority shall acknowledge receipt within five business days. Applicants may track status updates via the online portal. Errors in submissions must be corrected within ten days to avoid delays.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Government loans to strategic industries shall require repayment terms and interest rates approved by the finance minister. Loan agreements must include performance benchmarks and audit provisions. Borrowers shall submit semiannual performance reports. The finance ministry may convert loans to equity under conditions set forth in Clause 41.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Records disposal by government agencies shall follow the retention schedules published by the national archives in Clause 64. Disposal methods shall ensure confidentiality and prevent unauthorized recovery. Agencies must certify destruction of records annually. Unauthorized disposal may lead to administrative penalties.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Fire safety standards for public buildings shall adhere to the national building code. Safety measures must include fire alarms, sprinkler systems, and clearly marked exits. Fire drills shall be conducted at least twice annually. Certification of compliance shall be posted in a prominent location.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Inspection reports from fire safety audits shall be submitted to the local fire authority as required in Clause 77. Reports must document deficiencies and recommended corrective actions. Building owners shall implement corrections within sixty days. Failure to do so may result in closure orders.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Public health agencies shall coordinate vaccination campaigns during declared health emergencies. Campaign plans must include target populations, distribution logistics, and public outreach strategies. Agencies shall report campaign metrics to the health ministry monthly. Failure to meet vaccination targets may trigger additional funding authorizations.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Authorized health ministry officials shall review vaccination campaign performance against metrics set out in Clause 79. Officials may reallocate resources or adjust strategies based on performance data. Revised plans shall be submitted to the cabinet for approval within thirty days. Approved revisions take effect immediately upon notification.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Digital signatures used in electronic transactions shall comply with the Electronic Commerce Act. Signatures shall be generated using secure cryptographic protocols and validated by a recognized certification authority. Certification authorities must maintain records of issued certificates for a minimum of five years. Disputes concerning signature authenticity shall be adjudicated by the digital disputes tribunal.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: The national land registry shall maintain accurate and up-to-date records of property ownership. Registry updates must be submitted electronically using the secure platform described in Clause 81. Errors discovered in registry entries must be corrected within thirty days of notification. The registry authority shall conduct annual audits to verify data integrity.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Artificial Intelligence systems used for automated loan approvals shall be transparent and auditable. Lenders employing AI models must provide applicants with explanations of credit decisions, including factors and weightings used by the algorithm. Systems shall be regularly tested for fairness, bias, and discriminatory outcomes. Results of bias audits must be reported to the financial regulator annually.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Government agencies may enter into public-private partnerships to fund infrastructure projects. Partnership agreements shall define roles, responsibilities, and performance targets for each party. Financial terms, including revenue-sharing mechanisms, must be clearly specified. All partnership contracts shall be subject to legislative approval and public disclosure.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Any dispute arising from contract performance under this Act shall first be submitted to mediation. If mediation fails, the matter shall proceed to arbitration in accordance with the Arbitration Rules provided in Clause 45. Arbitration awards shall be final and binding on the parties. Courts may enforce arbitration awards under the Arbitration Act.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Organizations utilizing machine learning for employee performance evaluations must ensure algorithmic accountability. Evaluation algorithms shall be explainable and subject to human review before final decisions. Data used for training must be representative and free from prohibited personal identifiers. Annual compliance reports shall include model performance metrics and fairness assessments.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Trademark applicants shall submit specimens of use demonstrating commercial adoption. Specimens must accurately reflect how the mark is used in commerce. The trademark office shall examine specimens and issue office actions within ninety days. Applicants shall respond to office actions within sixty days or risk abandonment.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Employers shall calculate employee wages in compliance with applicable labor standards. Payroll records must include hours worked, rate of pay, and deductions, and be retained for at least seven years. The labor authority may audit records to verify compliance with wage laws. Discrepancies found during audits shall be remedied within forty-five days of notice.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Consumers shall have a right to withdraw from subscription services at any time with a notice period of thirty days. Service providers must offer clear cancellation procedures and refrain from hidden fees. Upon cancellation, providers shall cease billing and confirm termination in writing within seven days. Unlawful contract terms shall be deemed void.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Municipalities shall implement separate collection systems for recyclable and non-recyclable waste as prescribed by the Environmental Protection Authority. Collected waste must be processed or disposed of in licensed facilities. Operators shall report waste volumes and disposal methods quarterly. Non-compliance may result in suspension of operating permits.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Autonomous drones deployed for precision agriculture shall be operated within line-of-sight or under approved beyond-visual-line-of-sight waivers. Drone systems must incorporate collision avoidance algorithms and real-time monitoring by qualified personnel. Data collected by drones, including imagery and sensor readings, shall be secured and encrypted. Operators must maintain flight logs and incident reports for two years.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Individuals providing professional services, including legal, medical, or engineering consultations, shall obtain and maintain current occupational licenses. Licensees must complete continuing education requirements as specified by their professional boards. Boards may suspend or revoke licenses for ethical violations. Licensed professionals must carry professional liability insurance.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: All algorithmic systems used for social welfare benefit determinations shall ensure algorithmic transparency. Benefit applicants must be informed of the use of AI tools including details of data inputs and decision logic. Systems shall be audited annually by an independent authority for accuracy and fairness. Audit results shall be published in redacted form to protect privacy.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Rail infrastructure operators shall adhere to the safety standards set by the National Railway Safety Board. Regular track inspections must be performed at intervals not exceeding six months. Operators shall maintain records of maintenance and repair activities. Emergency response procedures shall be documented and rehearsed annually.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Microfinance institutions shall establish lending criteria that balance financial sustainability with social impact objectives. Lending decisions shall consider borrower creditworthiness and repayment capacity. Institutions must submit annual impact reports detailing loan outcomes and default rates. Regulatory authorities may adjust capital requirements based on risk assessments.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Government welfare agencies shall implement reporting protocols consistent with algorithmic audits described in Clause 93. Reporting systems must track case outcomes and demographic data to assess system performance. Agencies shall address identified biases through corrective action plans. Plans shall be updated following each annual audit cycle.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Healthcare providers shall submit immunization records to a centralized national database. Records must include patient identification, vaccine type, dosage, and administration date. Data entries shall be verified against official vaccine lot records. The health ministry shall ensure secure storage and authorized access to the database.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Neural networks employed in predictive policing must be governed by strict ethical guidelines. Law enforcement agencies shall ensure that training data sets are free from racial or socioeconomic bias. Predictions generated by such systems may not be the sole basis for enforcement actions and must be reviewed by human officers. Transparency measures shall include publication of algorithmic methodology and oversight committee findings.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Building codes for seismic regions shall require structures to withstand specified ground acceleration forces. Engineers must certify compliance through detailed structural analysis reports. Certificates of occupancy may not be issued without such certification. Retrospective strengthening of legacy buildings shall follow standards set by the Earthquake Safety Commission.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Telemedicine providers shall obtain licenses to deliver remote medical services across jurisdictional boundaries. Licenses shall require proof of medical credentials and compliance with patient privacy laws. Service providers must ensure that telehealth consultations meet standards equivalent to in-person visits. Records of telemedicine sessions shall be maintained for a minimum of seven years.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Educational institutions using cognitive systems for adaptive learning platforms must ensure student data privacy and algorithmic fairness. Platforms shall allow for parental opt-out of data profiling features. Institutions must conduct bias training for educators on interpreting system recommendations. Annual evaluations of learning outcomes with respect to system performance shall be published in institutional reports.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Riparian water rights shall be allocated based on equitable distribution principles and historical usage. Water users must register entitlements with the Water Management Authority. Transfers of water rights require prior approval and public notice. Disputes over allocations shall be resolved by the Water Tribunal.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Political campaign contributions shall be disclosed publicly within ten days of receipt. Contribution limits shall apply per donor per campaign cycle as set by the Elections Commission. Accepting funds from prohibited entities shall result in campaign disqualification. Enforcement procedures are described in Clause 66.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Universities adopting technology-driven teaching methods shall adhere to data protection and fairness guidelines as referenced in Clause 101. Institutional policies must include provisions for human oversight of automated grading mechanisms. Annual compliance audits shall evaluate system usage and student feedback. Audit summaries shall be made available to accreditation bodies.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Protected wildlife areas shall be established and managed according to the Wildlife Conservation Act. Activities within designated zones are subject to permit requirements. Poaching or unauthorized resource extraction shall incur criminal penalties. Conservation plans must be reviewed and updated every five years.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Employers shall contribute to employee pension funds at rates determined by collective bargaining agreements. Contributions must be remitted monthly to the pension authority. Late payments shall incur interest as specified in Clause 19. Employers shall provide annual statements of contributions to employees.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Industrial robots used in manufacturing must be equipped with safety sensors and emergency stop mechanisms. Manufacturers shall submit risk assessments detailing robot-human interaction protocols. Maintenance logs shall record software updates and hardware inspections. Compliance with robotic safety standards is mandatory prior to deployment.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Prescription drug monitoring programs shall collect data on controlled substance prescriptions. Prescribers must report patient, drug, dosage, and dispensing pharmacy information within 24 hours. Monitoring boards may review data to identify potential misuse or diversion. Records shall be retained for at least five years.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Smart algorithms for energy grid optimization shall dynamically balance supply and demand using real-time data. Grid operators shall maintain manual override capabilities for all automated adjustments. Algorithmic performance metrics, including efficiency gains and incident logs, shall be reported monthly. Reports shall comply with cybersecurity standards outlined in Clause 18.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: State secret classification levels shall be applied in accordance with the Official Secrets Act. Officials granted access to classified information must complete security clearance procedures. Unauthorized disclosure of classified information is punishable by law. Classification reviews shall occur biennially or upon substantial changes to security protocols.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Energy providers integrating renewable sources must follow operational protocols and reporting requirements as described in Clause 109. Providers shall conduct system resilience tests under varying load conditions. Test results shall be submitted to the energy regulator for review. Providers must address identified deficiencies within ninety days.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Small claims courts shall adjudicate civil disputes involving claims up to a statutory monetary limit. Procedures shall be simplified to allow self-representation. Decisions shall be issued within thirty days of the final hearing. Judgments shall be enforceable as any other civil court order.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Food safety inspectors shall conduct surprise inspections of food service establishments at least once per year. Inspections must verify compliance with hygiene, storage, and preparation standards. Establishments failing inspections shall receive corrective action orders. Closure orders may be issued for repeated or severe violations.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Autonomous systems used in public transportation, including driverless trains and buses, shall comply with safety regulations and human oversight requirements. Operators must conduct passenger safety drills and maintain communication channels with a central control center. Autonomous vehicle logs shall be archived for at least three years. Regulatory approval must precede any commercial deployment.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Arts councils shall administer grants to cultural organizations through competitive selection processes. Selection criteria shall include artistic innovation, community engagement, and financial stewardship. Grant cycles and deadlines shall be published annually. Recipients must submit project completion reports within six months.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Tax credits for apprenticeship programs shall be available to employers who hire registered apprentices. Credits shall be calculated based on apprentice wages and training expenditures. Employers must provide documentation to the tax authority as specified in Clause 57. Credits may be claimed annually upon submission of certified apprenticeship records.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Logistics providers employing intelligent automation for warehouse management shall ensure system reliability and data security. Automated inventory systems must synchronize with human-operated processes to prevent discrepancies. Providers shall conduct system performance validations quarterly. Validation reports shall be available for regulatory inspection.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Beverage alcohol licensing authorities shall issue permits to establishments meeting zoning, safety, and training requirements. Permit holders must comply with age verification and responsible service regulations. Licenses shall be renewed biennially upon payment of fees. Authorities may conduct compliance checks at any time.
clauses.label: No

clauses.text: Algorithmic systems used in medical imaging diagnostics shall undergo clinical validation and regulatory approval. Imaging software employing deep learning neural networks must demonstrate sensitivity and specificity benchmarks. Healthcare providers shall retain original image data and algorithm output records. Validation study results shall be published in peer-reviewed journals.
clauses.label: Yes

clauses.text: Foreign investments in strategic sectors shall be subject to review by the national investment board. Investors must file detailed proposals including ownership structure and funding sources. The board may impose conditions to safeguard national security interests. Decisions shall be rendered within 120 days of application submission.
clauses.label: No
